intro: Plagiogyria matsumurana, commonly known as the Japanese plagiogyria, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered white flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Plagiogyria matsumurana thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
